bibl.title: Letter from L.O. Howard to Howard A. Kelly, November 27, 1905

div1.p: Howard forwards to Kelly statistics on yellow fever cases from New Orleans epidemics.

div1.head: Letter from L.O. Howard to Howard A. Kelly, November 27, 1905
div1.opener:
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE,
BUREAU OF ENTOMOLOGY,
WASHINGTON, D. C.
November 27, 1905.
Dear Doctor Kelly:
div1.p:
Doctor Stiles writes me, under date of November 25,
that in conversation with Doctor Hurd relative to your Life of Doctor
Walter Reed he told Doctor Hurd that I had figures comparing this
year's New Orleans epidemic with those of previous years; whereupon
Doctor Hurd asked Doctor Stiles to obtain from me the comparison or
at least reference to the statistics. It gives me pleasure to send
you a table handed me by Dr. J. H. White, in New Orleans on November
8th, and which was drawn up for the epidemics prior to 1905 by Dr.
Stanford E. Chaillé, the figures for 1905 having been added in by
Doctor White or some of his assistants. You are quite at liberty to
use this in your Life of Doctor Walter Reed, and it seems to me that
it is an overwhelming proof of the efficacy of treatment on the mosquito
basis. The epidemics of 1867 and 1878 are the ones which should be
compared with that of 1905, and it must be pointed out that the epi-
demic of the present year started in to be more severe than the others;
also that the Public Health and Marine-Hospital Service did not begin
its anti-mosquito work under its full control until August 12th this
year. Doctor Chaillé's table is simply a monthly mortality table,
but the totals are of extreme significance.

I have also a long daily statement of new cases, total cases,
deaths, total deaths, from July 21 to the end of the epidemics of
1878, 1897 and 1905; but this is too long for my people here to copy.
FROM DR. HOWARD A. KELLY
If you wish to have it copied at your expense by some outside type-
writer, I will have it done for you.
div1.closer:
Yours most truly, L.o. Howard
Chief of Bureau. Dr. Howard A. Kelly,
Johns Hopkins Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
